clinical_study.brief_title: Multidisciplinary Intervention for Mild Cognitive Impairment
clinical_study.official_title: Novel Functional Medicine Intervention With Cognitive Training for Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI): A Multiple Baseline Study Across Cases

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this investigation is to conduct a series of case studies on the impact of a novel functional medicine approach to improving cognitive skills, brain structure, and daily functioning for participants with Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI).

detailed_description.textblock: Using a multiple baseline design across cases with start point randomization, the proposed study will examine the outcomes from a combination of optimized diet, exercise, nutritional supplements, and cognitive training across domains on standardized measures used to monitor treatment effectiveness for Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI).

primary_outcome.measure: Evidence of overall cognitive function improvement
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 14 days after completing the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Confirmed by change in pretest to post-test scores on the Dementia Rating Scale (DRS-2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of improvement in executive function
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 14 days after completing the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: As confirmed by pretest to post-test changes on the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Adult Version (BRIEF-A)

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of improvement in cognitive flexibility
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 14 days after completing the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: As confirmed by pretest to post-test changes on a Trail Making Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of change in brain structure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 30 days after completing the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Confirmed by change in pretest to post-test neuroimaging using MRI

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of improvement in visual attention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: with 14 days after completing the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Confirmed by change in pretest to post-test scores on the Conners Continous Performance Test (CPT-3)

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of improvement in auditory attention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: with 14 days after completing the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Confirmed by change in pretest to post-test scores on the Auditory Attention Test (CATA)

arm_group.description: The intervention includes a physician-directed diet, exercise, and nutritional supplementation regimen, combined with a 60-hour, clinician-delivered cognitive training program created by LearningRx.

intervention.description: A clinician will deliver three 90-minute cognitive training sessions per week for 14 weeks. There are 16 different categories of leveled training procedures sequenced in intensity and difficulty for a total of 530 training tasks.
Participants will be given dietary recommendations and nutritional supplements to optimize cognition.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 50+ previously diagnosed with MCI
- Living in the greater Colorado Springs area
Exclusion Criteria:
- No braces, metal implants, or claustrophobia that would contraindicate magnetic resonance imaging
